Comment: They make you jump over so many hurdles during the long interview process very time consuming. They never came back with an answer only months later when I wrote them (multiple times) did they say they chose someone else months before. Very disrespectful

Was well planned smooth and to the point. The questions ranged from skill and competency identification personal background exposure to the industry and technical experience. There were some openended and some leading questions. in 30 mins the interview covered a wide spectrum of personal and professional traits

the interview was handled extremely professionally was very well organized and efficient. I was given  preparatory material and adequate notice to be able to prepare in advance. I was interviewed by a committee that was very well prepared and had carefully studied my materials.

My interview consisted of two stages. The first a test consisting of two questions to be sent within 24 hours. The second by an oral interview with questions related to the skills required for the internship position

60 minute online written assessment using VidCruiter which consisted of 10 questions each worth 10 points. Then there was also a  competency based interview. which was a structured approach towards asking questions based on previous experiences.

No transparency at all. The recruitment processs cancels without notification. Presumably it is a bad custom of international organizations that preselect candidate(s) already exists always. Good for women to get hired as the director is aiming to make a 50:50 gender ration by 2024.

Initial prerecorded video interview with 5 questions related to the position some technical some managerial. This is followed by a panel interview with technical experts and the hiring manager. Standard questions are given to all interviewees.

Competencybased interview but also substantive technical questions. Significant preparation required. I'd recommend reading up on how to interview with the IAEA specifically. Generally speaking you will need to meet all of the requirements and then some to receive an interview.

I received an invitation for an interview within 7 days from applying for the role that was limited for 1 year. The interview was planned to be online through the software IAEA uses SONRU given the fact the job level was international and regardless of the fact that I was based in Vienna and hence could attend it personally. I recorded my interview following a thorough preparation. Just after I did it I noticed in IAEA recruitment portal that this position was cancelled/closed and exactly the same one yet with a contract for 3 years was advertised. So instantly I applied for the latter. Never heard back from HR department regarding feedback on my SONRU interview for a 1year role nor was considered for an exactly the same role yet with a 3years contract.
It was in person interview and I had to meet them in an office it was calm and stressed. Also very informal with no monitoring. Then I had to wait 3 months to hear anythign back

Interview took place in front of 3 interviewers asking inapropriate question about my political views and making clear my european ethnicity and my gender would be a disadvantage in the interview process. Also the one person from HR was 30 minutes late.

Das Gespräch war sehr klar strukturiert zwischen Personalabteilung ausschreibender Fachabteilung und einer weiteren als neutrale Stelle. Es wurde nach spezifischen Kenntnissen im relevanten Bereich gefragt. Die Fragen bezogen sich auf meine berufliche Erfahrung und auf die Erwartungen an die Stelle.

Applied via the iaea platform. Got a Skype interview invitation in 2 weeks. There were 3 interviewers. The interview lasted for 20 minutes. One person was asking questions another 2 were observing me and took notes. At the end they contacted me via email and told me I was rejected. They gave me very positive feedback however. Still didn't explain me why they rejected me.

The interview was done using Sonru with preprepared questions. Technical Support was given prior to interview; and it was possible to test the Sonru application before starting the interview. During the interview itself a few minutes were given before you had to answer and a timer showed up on the screen.
ÜbermittlungszeitFragen für weitere Überprüfung der Bewerber (Online).  Eine stundenlange schriftliche Prüfung  Persönliche Vorstellungsgespräche
I applied through their website.  Heard back about six months later.  I had a 40 minute phone call with the manager and he offered me a 6 month position on the spot.

The post was advertised on their website and applications done on their website. After a few months a competencybased interview was done remotely. Then a few months letter a competencybased interview done via videoconferencing.
Es war eine Videokonferenz zwischen mir und fünf weiteren Personen. Drei Techies und zwei HRBüroleute.

Das Einstellungsverfahren ist langsam dauert in den meisten Fällen über ein Jahr und es gibt etwa 200 Lebensläufe für jeden Beitrag. Zuerst gibt es ein computergestütztes Matching basierend auf elektronischen Filtern dann ein Review durch die Manager dann ein PanelInterview mit Endauswahl. Ein durchschnittliches Interview beinhaltet 10 Fragen vor 5 Person. Beachten Sie dass das Visum Sponsoring der UN bedeutet dass Sie im Wettbewerb mit einem globalen Markt sind.
